basics.name: Prathamesh Devadiga
basics.label: Research Intern at IIT Indore
basics.summary: An aspring ML Engineer/Data Scientist, also the Co-Founder and President of Catalysis (NGO) focussed on providing practical knowledge.

work.name: Working on CybSec-Deep Learning approaches.
work.summary: I am currently specializing in the intersection of cybersecurity and Deep Learning, specifically focusing on developing techniques for malware detection. I leverage Deep Learning methodologies to advance innovative approaches in identifying and addressing evolving malware threat

work.name: Working on Intersection of Clinical-AI.
work.summary: I am currently specializing in the field of Natural Language Processing, specifically focusing on developing LLMs.

work.name: Working on Intersection of Chemistry and Electronics
work.summary: Investigating radiation pollution and its impact on living creatures. Developing solutions to reduce pollution levels by 30%

volunteer.summary: Leading operations, budget management, and strategic planning for a non-profit empowering young minds through mentorship and education.

education.area: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Software Development

awards.title: Recipient of CNR Rao Scholarship
awards.summary: I have recieved this award for 2 semesters consecutively. This award is given to students performing academically excellent and for being in the top 5% of the batch.

awards.title: Winners of Arithemania 2.0 Hackathon
awards.summary: Secured first place in ”robotics and automation” domain, demonstrating innovative problem-solving skills.

awards.title: Winners of ”SHE-Summit” Ideathon
awards.summary: Championed the ideathon competition on ”Women Empowerment,” showcasing dedication to social causes.

awards.title: Winners of Cisco ThingQbator Hackathon 6.0
awards.summary: My team was among the winners, demonstrating innovative problem-solving skills.

certificates.name: CIE Level 1
certificates.issuer: Centre for Innovation and Entrepreneurship, PES University

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
